prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The final shape of part 1 is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length of the prism is twice the width, and the height is half the width. The prism is centered on a white background. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.0527, 0.0, 0.0 ] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system: 1. Create a new face. 2. Draw a line from point (0,0) to point (0.75,0). 3. Draw a line from point (0.75,0) to point (0.75,0.0469). 4. Draw a line from point (0.75,0.0469) to point (0,0.1719). 5. Draw a line from point (0,0.1719) to point (0,0). Close the loop and complete the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters from the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.0527, 0.0, 0.0 ] Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal vector with a depth of 0.0264 and along the opposite normal vector with a depth of 0.0264, creating a closed solid body. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom The final shape of part 2 is a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter, and the top and bottom of the cylinder are flat. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [ 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.0293, 0.0, 0.0625 ] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system: 1. Create a new face. 2. Draw a circle with center point (0.0234,0.0234) and radius 0.0234. Close the loop and complete the sketch. Extrude the 3D sketch along the negative Z axis with a depth of 0.125, creating a solid body and removing material from the prism. Note that the top and bottom of the cylinder are flat and the height is approximately three times its diameter.</description>
